title: Can Mana regen quicker in the fountain
body: I hate that if I leave lane because of 0 mana I have to sit around in fountain waiting for my mana to regen for a few seconds longer. Especially going up against energy champs. I would like the mana to regen a bit faster early game I already have to walk back to lane and since Energy and resourceless champs can run back to lane with no issues why can we not have quicker mana regen in fountain?

REMOVED: +50% base mana regeneration.
REMOVED UNIQUE PASSIVE: Restores 4 mana upon killing an unit.
NEW EFFECT: Grants 5 mana regeneration per 5 seconds.
NEW PASSIVE: Basic attacks deal 5 on-hit bonus physical damage to minions.

Doran’s ring is being reduced in power. This item has done a lot of things well for quite a while, and we are attempting to bring it inline with other starting items. This should also have the benefit of opening up a wider range of starting items for mages.
We’re increasing mana regen on the champions most affected by the Doran’s Ring changes, such that the champions will feel similar to their current state if they buy a Doran’s Ring, and better about their mana at very low levels if they by a number of other starting items.
Mages are getting some changes to their mana pools and their mana growth. They’ll be up a bit of starting mana and mana regen, but be substantially down on mana per level.
We’re changing the two biggest mana components - Lost Chapter and Tear of the Goddess - and making some light changes to a couple completed items. Full details below.

Ironically, it does - and I didn't think about it much til I saw this.  The mana and health regeneration rates in the Spawn area occur at "a percentage of the champion's maximum health and mana every second (Summoner's Rift 2.1% per 0.25 seconds".  This is multiplied by the characters own regeneration rates.  So it is actually both together.  And since the mana nerfs earlier this season, one does notice that the regeneration is so very much slower than it has been in the past.  It's about four seconds for some of the slower mana regenerating champs when it used to be closer to about 2 seconds.

No, because mages had their mana regen reduced and their maximum mana increased. Those two things already balance each other out. The fountain regen changes are negligible because things are already balanced out.
